The tailored content‚Äîsuch as interactive polls, quizzes, or relevant use-cases‚Äîeffectively re-engages students. The system empowers learners to interact with the generative AI, request alternative explanations, or confirm their understanding, thereby creating smarter, personalized learning experiences.Beyond my professional endeavours, I'm committed to giving back and shaping future leaders. Be smart and choose the latter.Hi, I‚Äôm Rituraj‚Äîa brand builder with 10 years of expertise, helping companies of all stages; from self-funded businesses to Series C startups.And during all these years winning strategies always took the same route -a) Find a winning categoryb) Position your brand as #1 option‚ÄúTbh, customers don‚Äôt care how good the product is if your brand doesn't feel relevant and the best option out there‚Äù.As of 2025, being a category leader is not a luxury but a must. People pay for the best, not for good enough.But how can everyone be #1? By simply building their category of one and ruling it.Some of the problems you can say goodbye to after this -- Getting forced into price competition- Marketing campaigns hitting plateaus- Unable to explain why your brand is better- Not having a clear recall in customer's head- Competition brands giving you a run for moneyYour brand is what will make or break your business.Without a clearly defined brand, you have - no recall- no targeting- no differentiation In short, no compelling reason to be trusted and considered by customers.So if you truly want to start selling, then stop experimenting with another $100k ad campaign or send email blast to another 500k quality leads.Get your act together as a brand and I promise, in next 100 days from today your brand will start selling itself.if you're serious about turning things around for your company thenDM me or book a 1:1 call oncal.com/rituraj-s/30min

linkedindescription: Driven by a deep passion for redefining the future of work, Jon is dedicated to shaping a world where technology and humanity thrive in partnership, unlocking the full potential of employees, teams, and organisations. His vision is bold: to create innovative, sustainable solutions that empower people to outperform in an AI-driven era, challenging traditional approaches to work and leadership.As Chief Technology Officer at Hemsley Fraser, Jon leads technological strategy and innovation, shaping the future of workforce transformation and performance. His portfolio of leadership roles, including Fractional HR & L&D AI Strategist, Chief AI Strategist at LPI, and Chair of the AI Learning Collective, underscores his unwavering commitment to advancing the integration of AI into HR, Learning, and Talent functions, always with a focus on human-centric impact.Over the past four years, Jon has been at the cutting edge of AI research, exploring its strategic and practical applications across the HR, Learning, and Talent industry. His belief is simple yet transformative: the organisations that succeed in the AI era are those that embrace it not as a tool but as a collaborator, driving human ingenuity to new heights. Jon‚Äôs mission is to empower HR, Learning, and Talent professionals to reimagine what‚Äôs possible in a Human + AI world. His core principle, ‚ÄòHuman + AI Performance,‚Äô goes beyond the rhetoric of replacement to highlight a synergistic partnership where AI enables employees to thrive, outperform, and innovate. Detailed in his white paper, Human + AI: Truly Redefining HR & L&D Beyond 2025, this philosophy inspires organisations to embrace the evolving AI landscape with a balance of ambition and responsibility.With over two decades of experience spanning technology, architecture, infrastructure, and operations, Jon brings a visionary perspective rooted in practical application. His accomplishments include designing and delivering global talent strategies, pioneering career and skills infrastructures, implementing modern technology ecosystems, and driving operational excellence for both startups and multinational organisations.Jon is not just a strategist but a disruptor of conventional thinking, inspiring leaders to challenge the status quo and build the future of work today. Whether rethinking HR‚Äôs role in the AI era or crafting transformative frameworks for employee performance, his work is a testament to the power of bold ideas and actionable strategies. Join Jon in exploring how we can redefine the future of work

linkedinheadline: Educating and Training the B2B eCommerce Industry. Global Director @ B2B eCommerce Association
linkedindescription: In 2007, I started a blog to write about B2B eCommerce when no one cared about B2B eCommerce.  When Grainger launched their new site in 2011, people googled "B2B eCommerce," and my little site was peppered over the first 10 pages of results.  My little blog had years of content, point of view,  and opinions - many of which are the foundation of the B2B eCommerce industry today.  I am very proud of that.The blog, and eventually my book ("Digital Branch Secrets"), launched my speaking career.  "My favorite thing to do professionally is to influence people through speaking.  I believe the best expression of my experience and my passion is my ability to communicate and simplify complex topics with large groups of people." In 2010 I joined Endeca to build the B2B positioning for hybris, and my life changed when I was introduced to the world of Software instead of consulting. After being acquired by Oracle, I eventually started B2X Partners and sold it to Salsify (founded by Endeca alums) in 2019.In 2023, I left Salsify and a leadership team I loved to join Brett Sinclair at B2B eCommerce Association (B2BEA). linkedindescription: Thanks for visiting my LinkedIn profile. I am a corporate finance and Strategy Executive, Business Coach, and Fractional CFO helping SMBs and startups scale up. My whole career has been at the intersection of finance, strategy, and anything growth-related. Let me share my journey with you...I started my finance career at GE in the Finance Management Program (FMP). I held various roles with increasing responsibility in corporate finance, including Finance Manager, FP&A Leader, Manufacturing Cost Accounting manager, and Commercial Finance. While working at GE Capital, I also underwrote structured loans to middle-market companies, managed a portfolio of cash flow and asset-backed loans, and subsequently led the capital markets team for GE in Latin America. linkedinheadline: The AI Doc I Fastest growing AI in Healthcare Newsletter - theHotBleep I Partner - Nudora, 1st condition-specific probiotics I AI Healthcare I MedTech I Healthtech I DigitalHealth I Robotics
linkedindescription: The year was 2018. I had just stepped off the stage at the Global Health Summit at the Hyatt Hotel in Jacksonville, fresh from giving a talk on how AI & tech would change the game in healthcare. The audience was baffled! Nobody got it back then. Some in the audience even thought I was stoned, luckily, they didn‚Äôt stone me off the stage. That night, I found myself at the Hyatt bar, as one does. Drink in hand and re-living the anti-climax presentation. The summit host walked past, gave me an awkward smile while gazing at my drink, as if to say ‚Äî aha, so this is why you were hallucinating on stage! Was I wrong? Legend has it that my grand-dad was the biggest gambler of his era, and I was named after him. So, I just smiled back and placed my biggest bet on AI becoming a winner. I knew I was way ahead of the curve.Fast forward to 2025, I‚Äôve now consulted over 100+ high-end companies on AI integration into Healthcare & Medtech. Within 6 months of joining LinkedIn in 2024, I was ranked #1 in the UK & Top 5 globally in ''Healthcare & Health Tech Experts'' (Favikon Rankings). My Beehiiv newsletter blew-up from zero to 40K+ subscribers in 8 months, making it the fastest-growing AI & Health Tech Newsletter.My bootstrapped company, theHotBleep, is now the largest AI-powered-database of Innovative Healthcare Companies. We‚Äôre currently working on an NDA partnership that‚Äôs about to change the game, stay tuned.But I‚Äôm not just all AI & tech. I love life and I love wellness. I am a partner in Nudora, the first-ever condition-specific probiotic brand. We‚Äôre reshaping gut health and wellness by creating the probiotic of tomorrow, spiced up with some exciting future AI. You need to check it out and come join us on ‚Äî https://nudora.com/At heart, I am a family man with the biggest dadabase of dad-jokes! So, if you love what I am about, and most importantly love life, let‚Äôs connect.Hi, I‚Äôm Dr Nik, welcome to my world!(yes, its just Dr Nik)BTW - you wouldn't guess who I bumped into in the bathroom at the most recent summit, THE SAME SUMMIT HOST FROM 2018!! Yeap, there he was, this time a bottle of Nudora probiotics in his hand! I just smiled at him, gazing at his Nudora probiotics, as if to say ‚Äî aha, I see you now believe in my vision!You can only connect the dots looking backwards.

linkedinheadline: PDG par int√©rim & Directeur de Programme IA/ML @ Aizzia, SARLPresident @ Atomico, LLC. A holding company
linkedindescription: Every great story starts with a why. At Atomico, LLC, our why has always been clear: to use technology to transform lives. For over fifteen years, we've leveraged Operation Research and Information Engineering to champion innovation believing that behind every data point is a human story.This belief led us most recently to the Mighty Linehauler project, revolutionizing FedEx Ground linehaul trucking. We saw an opportunity to make a real difference, recognizing that truckers - the unsung heroes of our economy - deserved more than just a job. They deserved a fulfilling career and respect.But purpose-driven journeys often lead to unexpected places. As we pushed the boundaries in logistics, we found ourselves at the cutting edge of a new frontier: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.That's why the next chapter of our story promises to be so exhilarating: I will be joining Aizzia SARL, a groundbreaking AI startup at Paris‚Äôs renowned Station F, as a pre-seed investor, EIR and Directeur de Programme IA/ML.Why Aizzia? Because it's the next logical step in my mission. AI and ML aren't just buzzwords - they're powerful tools that we‚Äôre passionate about and believe when used with unwavering purpose, can solve humanity's most pressing challenges. From healthcare to education, from climate change to logistics, AI can unlock new possibilities.But here's the crucial part: just like in our work with truckers, we believe the true power of AI lies not in replacing humans, but in empowering them. At Aizzia, our goal is to create AI that serves humanity, augments human potential, and helps people live fuller lives.This new role isn't a departure from our previous mission - it's an evolution. We're taking everything we've learned about using technology to empower people and applying it to the exciting world of AI and ML.Our why remains the same: to use technology to make lives better, to empower individuals, to solve real-world problems. The how may have changed - from logistics software to AI algorithms - but the purpose driving us forward is as strong as ever.The future isn't just about artificial intelligence. It's about augmented humanity. And that's a future worth creating. Let's get this thing moving. Build strong.

In the early 2000s, I co-founded and grew an IT company through a blend of organic growth and strategic mergers and acquisitions.In 2018, I founded Verdani Capital, my primary acquisition brand, and have since expanded my portfolio to include nine companies across three sectors. Our approach is defined by:Respect for Your Legacy: We honour the hard work you‚Äôve put into your business by ensuring a smooth transition and retaining your valued team.Long-Term Vision: We don‚Äôt simply take over a company; we buy, build, and nurture it.Ethical Growth: Doing right by our acquired businesses and their people is at the core of what we do.For Business OwnersIf you‚Äôre considering selling your business or seeking an investor to help you scale, our three-step process makes your exit strategy straightforward and stress-free:Initial Discussion: We‚Äôll talk through your business performance and objectives. If there‚Äôs a fit, we‚Äôll request the last three years of accounts for valuation.Proposal: Based on our assessment, we‚Äôll propose a purchase or investment structure that meets your goals.Transaction: We‚Äôll close the deal, ensuring a seamless transition for everyone involved.For Aspiring BuyersIf you‚Äôre looking into buying businesses and need bespoke, one-to-one mentoring, I‚Äôll personally guide you‚Äîfrom identifying opportunities to structuring your first deal and beyond. linkedinheadline: CEO, Epic Entrepreneur Media | Helped 800+ entrepreneurs grow and monetize on LinkedIn | DM me ‚ÄúGrowth‚Äù to get started.
linkedindescription: After building a $3M business the hard way (think 16-hour days and endless stress), I learned success shouldn't cost your soul. My journey started rough: a former ski racer turned chef, battling addiction by 15, and spending 15 years using substances to mask deeper struggles.Getting sober led me to "safety" - a corporate job at Sysco making $80K. But trading 60-hour weeks for someone else's dream wasn't freedom. I built up the courage to quit and launched a rare coin business, scaling it to $3M in annual revenue with 25% profit margins in just 18 months. The money was good, but the cost was crushing.16-hour days, constant stress, and fear about where the next lead would come from.The wake-up call? Rolling my truck at 75mph after a night of heavy drinking. I survived, barely. That's when I knew something had to change.Enter LinkedIn. While others chased leads through cold calls and expensive ads, I discovered what elite entrepreneurs already knew.Personal branding is the ultimate client magnet. I transformed my approach, and everything shifted.Within a year, I built a 150,000+ following and a 7-figure coaching business - all through organic LinkedIn growth. Now I work 4-hour days from Playa del Carmen, with a steady stream of inbound leads.But here's what really lights me up: I've helped hundreds of others achieve the same transformation. The truth? LinkedIn isn't just a platform - it's a path to the freedom you've been chasing. If it could transform my life from rock bottom to abundance, imagine what it could do for you.Love always,D.

linkedinheadline: Gen Z entrepreneur who launched a biz during a global pandemic at 15 and never looked back. Now, as the founder of That GenZ Agency ‚ú®, I assist brands marketing to my generation.
linkedindescription: ‚ÄúIt got pretty tiring,‚ÄùAfter trailing around 17 local fast-food joints looking for a job, and being rejected by all of them, a Missouri teen decided not to give up and instead change his track.Bell, a full-time student and senior at Parkview High School, said he always knew he had the spirit to work for himself in the future; however, he didn‚Äôt know that it would be before the age of 18. After being turned down by local businesses, the then-15-year-old knew he had something much coveted in the modern world‚Äîand he knew he could use it.‚ÄúI‚Äôm part of Gen Z,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúGrowing up with technology and social media is something I‚Äôve always been great at.‚ÄùWith some past experience in marketing, combined with educating himself in learning algorithms and how social media truly works, Bell launched his own business‚ÄîBells Marketing Consultant LLC, a digital marketing firm in Springfield‚Äîat the onset of the pandemic in April 2020.With a mission to help small companies get through the pandemic and survive the unpredicted, the whizz-kid took charge of managing their social media accounts, online marketing, search engine optimization, and web design.‚ÄúI wanted to make an impact on business owners‚Äô lives, providing the highest quality of services while maintaining a healthy business relationship,‚Äù Bell said.Almost two years on, the business is a resounding success.‚ÄúI‚Äôve grown my company and now have five employees to help me out,‚Äù the young entrepreneur said. ‚ÄúI worked with 15-plus small companies in 2021. What I consider success is knowing I‚Äôm an asset to other companies and not just my own.‚ÄùBell‚Äôs incredible work ethic has earned him praise from his clients. According to News-Leader, Brent Gilstrap, a realtor with ReeceNichols Real Estate, contacted Bell on LinkedIn after being amused by his profile.Impressed by his story, Gilstrap hired Bell to increase his social media presence.‚ÄúHe came back and he had a proposal and a fee for what he was going to do and it was just incredible,‚Äù Gilstrap said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs got a great work ethic, a great mindset.‚ÄùCrediting Bell for an increase in his social media presence, Gilstrap added that, while communicating with the teen, it didn‚Äôt seem like he was in high school.‚ÄúNever tell anyone you‚Äôre too young to start a business, not even your parents,‚Äù Bell said. ‚ÄúWe are the generation that‚Äôs going to change the world; no one is stopping you but yourself. Break that habit, live, learn, and love what you‚Äôre doing, it‚Äôs working for me, and it can you.‚Äù

linkedindescription: I've worked in the animation field for 30+ years, in a variety of positions. From designer to storyboard artist, storyboard supervisor, art director, director, producer, executive producer, series creator, studio owner, and just about everything in between. I was very fortunate during my role as director at Warner Bros to win the coveted Emmy Award for directing, and a Prism Award for my storyboard work, on Pinky and the Brain. I also co-created and co-produced the hit series Atomic Betty which proudly aired on Teletoon in Canada, M6 in France, Cartoon Network in the U.S. and UK, and in over 107 countries. It was nominated for multiple Canadian Screen Awards, Leo Awards, and the prestigious British Academy of Film and Television Arts award.Although no longer affiliated with the studio, I am one of the original founders of Atomic Cartoons, which has been going strong for over 25 years and is now part of Thunderbird‚Äôs dynamic group of companies. Today I am a proud partner in Slap Happy Cartoons, one of Vancouver‚Äôs finest animation studios, and one of the longest running artist-owned-and-operated shops on the continent. We are currently in development (for CBC) on the animated Beachcombers with our project partners, Maximum Effort. I‚Äôve had the honour and great fortune to have been involved with clients such as Netflix, Warner Bros., Marvel, Nickelodeon, Hasbro, Nelvana, Mainframe, PBS, Mattel, Spinmaster, EOne, Cookie Jar, Sony/Sunbow, Klasky Csupo, and Disney...to name but a few.Still getting my hands dirty in the trenches and keeping the skills and pencil sharp, my most recent animation roles have been supervising storyboards on Nickelodeon‚Äôs Bossy Bear, PBS' award-winning series, Molly Of Denali' and Spin Master Entertainment's Mighty Express, airing on Netflix.

linkedinheadline: Helping startups get funded & investors find unicorns. Founder @spectup | Venture Scout @Flashpoint VC | Startups + sarcasm + ‚òïÔ∏è. Follow or regret it.
linkedindescription: If you‚Äôre here, you‚Äôre probably curious about who I am and what we do at spectup. Let me fill you in.I started my career with a banking apprenticeship, thinking I‚Äôd spend my life crunching numbers. But then I discovered startups‚Äîand everything changed.At N26, the fintech unicorn, I got my first taste of the fast-paced world of innovation. I fell in love with the chaos, creativity, and energy. After that, I joined Civey, where I dove into digital market research, business models, and marketing strategies.Then came Deutsche Bahn, where I worked on international expansion, competitor analysis, and market strategies. I learned how to make sense of complex industries (global transport markets, anyone?) and drive growth.At diffferent (yes, that‚Äôs how it‚Äôs spelled), I helped brands like Audi and Zalando identify growth opportunities and design innovative business strategies. And at Deloitte‚Äôs Innovation & Ventures team, I worked on building future-proof businesses with cutting-edge tech.One highlight? Leading 30+ projects at the BMW Startup Garage, helping startups find their place in the world of mobility. That‚Äôs where I saw the real power of connecting startups with the right partners.Now, I‚Äôm building Spectup. We work with growth-stage companies and select early-stage startups, helping them raise capital, connect with the right investors, and position themselves for long-term success.We also work with investors‚ÄîPEs, VCs, angels, and family offices‚Äîhelping them find promising, vetted companies to invest in without spending countless hours on due diligence.Why? Because startups fail too often, and investors waste too much time looking for the right opportunities. We‚Äôre here to bridge that gap.Whether you‚Äôre a founder looking for investors or an investor seeking quality opportunities, Spectup is about making those connections‚Äîand making them work.Let‚Äôs build something great together.Cheers,Niclas

linkedinheadline: Guiding small business owners to leverage expenses to help build wealth üí≤üí≤üí≤and reduce tax bill without overwhelm‚óÜ
linkedindescription: As a small business owner, you put everything (time/ energy/ focus /money) back into your business. You probably don‚Äôt have a retirement plan or a clear exit strategy. You make a living, but without a strategy to convert that into personal wealth, you might end up giving it to the IRS. What happens when you retire? When you get home after a long day you want to be with your family. Who wants to do financial planning? You shouldn‚Äôt do it alone. I‚Äôm Bonnie Clark, after decades serving clients well in financial services, I learned strategies that work in both short and long term, by providing both increased cash flow now and tax-free wealth for retirement.Recently I customized a plan for a business owner turning sixty. Her husband died without life insurance and left her the business. The day after he died of cancer, she had to go to work running a company that wasn‚Äôt in great shape. She didn‚Äôt have long until retirement, no exit strategy, and no retirement savings to speak of.Once we implemented her customized plan she said, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so happy to have a path forward, I have peace of mind, I‚Äôm protected, my family is protected and it‚Äôs not dependent on me being able to work every day for the rest of my life.‚ÄùSmall business owners come to me when they...‚úî Would love to leverage the cash flow of their business to grow wealth for themselves but don't know how to make that happen.‚úî Want to remove the IRS as a retirement income partner legally & ethically, enabling them to share more with their loved ones.‚úî Desire control of their financial future while enjoying liquidity, use, and control today.Imagine within 45 days starting your plan to...üéØ Manage risk, let you sleep at night, and grow assets independent from outside factors such as stock market loss and tax increases. üéØ Have protection from the "what ifs" in lifeüéØ See your expenses starting to work for youWatch this brief video that explains how it works (https://youtu.be/Z1sDip23png). Nothing hidden, and no obligation.

In Brandscale Academy, I work with coaches, consultants, freelancers and small business to build a high ticket revenue model + predictable system to generate consistent cash.üìåMy background:In 2012, I landed in USA from India. I had a plan to do another MBA from an elite university and get placed in corporate America and live my dream life with my new husband. World came crashing down when I got divorced and due to consistent worries, shame, guilt and loneliness, I develop mental health disorder that we call anxiety & panic disorder. Long story short, while I was on the path of healing myself especially my emotional being, I also felt a surge to explore my real potential. As much as I was leaning on for even a highly paid secure job, my heart was gravitating to share my story and build my Life & Career coaching practice.So, I started building my brand on LinkedIn in early 2019. And the results were pretty amazing.In just 12 months I grew from zero followers to over 25,000.Since that day, I've coached thousands through my online coaching programs and one-on-one consultations. Because I built my one-person business online, people wanted me help them launch & grow their online business. My mission is to simplify Branding & Marketing for entrepreneurs, founders and start ups. linkedinheadline: CEO at QuantSpark and Executive Director at Tech Against Terrorism
linkedindescription: Adam Hadley is an innovative entrepreneur and leader at the forefront of using data science, analytics, and AI to transform businesses and national security. As the founder and CEO of QuantSpark, he leads a team dedicated to building software that revolutionises organisations across various sectors.QuantSpark, under Adam's leadership, is a transformative force in the AI landscape, developing data solutions to supercharge businesses, fuel the UK economy, and enhance national security. The company's ambitious goal is to add 1% to the UK's GDP through innovative AI implementations, positioning itself at the vanguard of technological progress and economic growth.Alongside his work at QuantSpark, Adam serves as the Founder and Executive Director of Tech Against Terrorism, a UN-supported initiative empowering the global tech sector to tackle terrorist exploitation of the internet whilst respecting human rights. His expertise lies in combining approaches from computer science and counter-terrorism to analyse and combat terrorist propaganda. Under his guidance, Tech Against Terrorism has developed innovative solutions such as the Terrorist Content Analytics Platform, which helps identify and alert platforms to verified terrorist content online.In recognition of these contributions, Adam was appointed Commander of the Order of the British Empire (CBE) by King Charles III in 2024, reflecting the potential of analytics and AI in making a positive impact on society and national security. Additionally, he was honoured with the Barclays 2024 Serial Entrepreneur Award, cementing his status as a leader in the field.As QuantSpark moves into 2025, Adam is leading the charge in the widespread adoption of agentive systems, viewing AI as a powerful co-pilot rather than a replacement for human intelligence. He emphasises the importance of continuous learning, thoughtful implementation, and an open mind to the possibilities these technologies present.Adam's vision extends beyond commercial success to societal progress. Through QuantSpark and Tech Against Terrorism, he is committed to using technology to protect democracy, foster economic growth, and improve lives across the United Kingdom. His work exemplifies how advanced analytics and artificial intelligence can be leveraged to address complex global challenges and create a safer, more prosperous world.

linkedindescription: Since 2016, A.J. resides in South Florida.  In 2023, A.J. launched SixPoint Capital, the worlds first dedicated hybrid capital investor to fintech lenders and embedded finance platforms in emerging markets globally.  SixPoint strives to provide non-dilutive growth capital to support the growth of a fintech securitization ecosystem.  He also provides senior advisory services thru his advisory business, Akses Advisors, to a number of FinTech start-ups, primarily in emerging markets private credit, but also in developed markets, where he is able to use his expertise in corporate finance, structured credit, fund formation, underwriting, capital markets structuring and syndication, legal & operations, and management. A.J. provides restructuring advice (liabilities and corporate) to distressed private companies. A.J. also advises family offices and private credit funds on investments into FinTech direct loan origination and embedded finance platforms in emerging markets.  From 1998 - 2016, A.J. was based in Europe and focused primarily on capital market and corporate finance transactions for large industrial corporations and financial institutions (insurance as well as banks). His first 8 years was spent in private practice as a corporate finance and capital markets lawyer (dual-qualified US/UK). Thereafter, he worked within investment banking as a capital markets structuring, advisory, origination and execution banker. During his banking career, A.J. focused on balance sheet client advisory with technical expertise balance sheet restructuring as well as liability and capital management, rating agency criteria (both corporates and FI issuers), accounting and tax treatment of capital, Basel capital guidelines for banks (including relevant local implementation, capital planning and RWA approaches), Solvency II capital rules for insurance companies, and market execution of proposed capital product transactions.  He also advised and executed various funding / credit transactions (structured credit, ABS / ABL, equity derivative, covered bonds, high yield bonds, and medium and long term senior unsecured funding) for clients. Overall, A.J. has been involved in more than 100 transactions, helping clients to raise more than US$150 billion from investors worldwide in many different asset classes and in many different currencies. Throughout his career, he has developed strong interpersonal and communication skills as well as managerial experience. He also has been able to cultivate and maintain strong client and professional relationships throughout the world.

linkedinheadline: Director at 10X Managers
linkedindescription: I'm Josh. 5 years ago, I became Gartner's least-qualified Sales Manager. I was 23.Responsible for 8 salespeople.Leading a ¬£5M+ business....all with no prior leadership experience.I was out of my depth, FULL of imposter syndrome, and had little support.Quickly, I realised that what made me a good salesperson would not make me a good people leader. I had to reinvent myself. I was desperate to do a good job 1) For me and my career and 2) for Gartner and my boss, who trusted me.So, I began to develop myself. I studied the best leaders in the world. I accessed their content, masterminds, courses...  just about anything I could get my hands on. On the way, I built a community of other managers and leaders on the same journey. We shared, learnt and grew with each other.The community was invaluable... but I had a new problem.I couldn't balance my day job with my responsibility for the community. So I quit as Gartner's least-qualified sales manager.... and became the world's least qualified Business Owner of a management development company.Deja Vu:- Out of my depth- Imposter syndrome- No experience in developing managers. But it hit me... this flaw is my exact value. I didn't have all the answers (*spoiler* no one does).But I knew exactly what the managers of today are struggling with, and I could connect them with what the best leaders in the world are doing to solve it. Since starting, we've spent thousands of hours and over ¬£250,000 investigating what the very best managers in the world are doing and reporting back on this. Not the theory. But what exactly do they do to deliver exponential results. This investigation is an ongoing journey I am documenting here. But the summary so far: FOLLOWER-FIRST LEADERSHIP.The single biggest differentiator between an average and high-performing manager is FOLLOWERSHIP. You can't lead if no one is following.High-performing leaders have a team that will run through a brick wall for them. I continue to document my learnings whilst building 10X Managers - the Management Development company I'd actually have loved to have access to as a manager. At 10X Managers, we empower managers to follow the world's best, as Follower-First Leaders, who deliver 10X the results of average leaders, delight their people, and reinvent the business for everyone's long-term success. Need to get up to speed? Take our Manager Maturity Assessment to get your scorecard that benchmarks your performance as a manager and leader: https://develop.10xmanagers.com/manager-maturity-score

linkedinheadline: Director
linkedindescription: Matt Hancock is the Managing Direct or of BBS, the UK's leading address data experts. He served in the UK Cabinet under three Prime Ministers, and is probably best known for his role as the Secretary of State for Health and Social Care from 2018 to 2021, where he led the NHS and the wider UK health system through the Covid pandemic and spearheaded the vaccine delivery programme. He also served as the UK's Digital Secretary where he introduced the Data Protection Act 2018. Alongside his work at BBS Matt is also an international advisor on healthtech, a sector close to his heart, and serves as a Director of Magnatech, an energy efficiency company. Matt's professional journey began at BBS, as an engineer in the 1990s, before he moved to the Bank of England and into politics. Identified with dyslexia during his first year at Oxford, Matt earned a first-class degree in Politics, Philosophy, and Economics, followed by a Master‚Äôs in Economics from Cambridge University. He founded the Accessible Learning Foundation in 2023 to support early identification of neurodiverse conditions, with which he remains closely involved.

linkedinheadline: Founder/Executive Officer
linkedindescription: My name is Andrew Penie, and this is my story.I fled my war-torn country with nothing but a backpack and memories of a once-prosperous childhood. After years as a refugee, I was resettled in Canada with a suitcase full of books, a few clothes, and $10 USD. The kindness and support I received from ordinary Canadians filled me with hope and gratitude.Determined to give back to the country that welcomed me, I faced numerous challenges, including failed business ventures and personal struggles. Through conversations with other immigrant entrepreneurs, I identified common barriers: lack of access to capital, expertise, institutions, and networks.Recognizing these challenges, I founded the Immigrant Idea and Innovation Center (Triple IC), the world‚Äôs first business "Accubator" tailored to immigrant entrepreneurs. Registered as a Canadian non-profit on January 6th, 2023, Triple IC aims to support immigrant entrepreneurs in turning their ideas into thriving businesses.Located in Hamilton, Triple IC provides mentorship, training, and resources, striving to be a beacon of hope for immigrant entrepreneurs across Canada. Our innovative Accubator model sets us apart as leaders in immigrant entrepreneurship, helping to create jobs and contribute to Canada's economy. For me, Triple IC is more than just a way to give back; it represents the resilience of the human spirit and the power of community.
linkedinskillslabel: Business Ownership, Start-up Leadership, Sponsorship, Start-up Ventures, Networking, Business Analysis, Business Development, Management Consulting, Mentoring, Training, Project Management, Make It Happen, Ecosystem, Business, Startups, Lean Startup, Economic Growth, Entrepreneurship, Community Impact, Startup Development
linkedinpreviousjobdescription: The Immigrant Idea and Innovation Center is a specialized program that is dedicated to providing resources and support to immigrant entrepreneurs who are starting new businesses in Canada. Our services are tailored to unlock the untapped talents and resources of immigrant entrepreneurs, create new economic opportunities, and contribute to the growth and development of the Canadian economyOur center offers a range of services and resources to immigrant entrepreneurs, including access to capital, mentorship, office space, and networking opportunities. We work closely with each entrepreneur to understand their unique needs and provide them with customized support and guidance throughout the startup process.One of our core beliefs is that immigrant entrepreneurs bring valuable skills, experience, and knowledge to the Canadian business community. By supporting these entrepreneurs, we can unlock their full potential and create new economic opportunities for all Canadians. We also believe that supporting immigrant entrepreneurs is a vital part of creating a more diverse and inclusive business community in Canada.Ultimately, TRIPLE IC is dedicated to unlocking the potential of immigrant entrepreneurs and creating new economic opportunities for all Canadians. We believe that by supporting these entrepreneurs, we can create a more vibrant, diverse, and inclusive business community in Canada. We invite immigrant entrepreneur looking to start or grow a business in Canada to learn more about our services and how we can help them achieve their goals.

linkedinheadline: President at Acme Concrete Raising & Repair Inc.
linkedindescription: My career journey started in the concrete installation field, where I gained valuable experience and became a proud member of the International Operating Engineers Union Local 150. A pivotal moment in my career came when I transitioned into environmental remediation, specializing in low-temperature thermal desorption technology. As a shareholding member of Midwest Soil Remediation, I successfully bid, sold, and managed multi-million-dollar environmental construction contracts, with projects spanning upstream Oil & Gas, Superfund sites, industrial and commercial facilities, and governmental installations across 22 states. My expertise encompasses equipment modifications, maintenance, project bidding, sales, and marketing. Throughout my tenure at MSR, I played a key role in the thermal remediation of over 1 million tons of contaminated soils.Building on this experience, I founded Acme Concrete Raising & Repair, Inc., a specialized company that delivers polyurethane concrete raising and stabilization services in the greater Chicago area. Initially focused on the residential market, Acme quickly expanded into the commercial, industrial, and municipal sectors. Our success is a testament to my unwavering commitment to our employees, dedication to quality, and the cultivation of strong, long-term relationships with key decision-makers.

linkedinheadline: I help businesses create an impact with my marketing agency "seventy nine" and bring their visions to life with impactful signage from my company "Unsigned Co"
linkedindescription: About MeCreating Demand ‚Äì That‚Äôs the Heart of My Mission.I run a number of related businesses. The first is seventy nine - a creative-led full service agency and The Unsigned Co  - a print and signage manufacturing company.seventy nine was created in 2009 as a traditional PR agency to complement my experiences as a journalist at local and national level and at a really amazing marketing agency - McCann. These experiences gave me the confidence to launch seventy nine pr with the support of family, friends and colleagues.Over the years seventy nine pr naturally evolved into seventy nine as we added more marketing services. Today, we are a creative-led marketing agency helping clients - especially SME's - to navigate the evolving marcomms landscape.Since 2009 the industry has changed rapidly especially social media and digital innovations. As an agency seventy nine's job is to sift through the jargon and the science and do the best we can to forge genuine connections between brands and their target audiences. Today, I head up an agency that is always striving for best in class, value marketing working with businesses and entrepreneurs of all sizes on every aspect of marketing from digital, content to paid search.In 2019 - having print managed and created designs for a number of clients, we decided to create The Unsigned Co - a full manufacturing unit based on wide format print and signage. The initial aim was to service our existing seventy nine clients which made the most sense. However, today we work with businesses and brands across the UK servicing all of them from our very own manufacturing facility in Leicester. We make everything in house with our own machines and finishing equipment. We also maintain and service signage across the UK with our own install crews. We now work across a number of industries with experience in designing, manufacturing and installing signs in airports, shopping centres, high streets, leisure complexes and offices.

linkedinheadline: Managing Partner at ECOVIS Wingrave Yeats > Auditor to International Mid-Market Companies > Advisor to International Mid-Market CFOs
linkedindescription: ‚ñ∫You can contact me at stuart.hinds@ecovis.co.uk or 07792 959813‚óÑI help International Mid-Market CFOs have painless global audits and deliver exceptional value to their companies; be highly respected by their colleagues; and have time to spend with their families and on their hobbies.I am a Chartered Accountant with a Chartered Diploma in Corporate Finance. I have over 28 years‚Äô experience in professional practice working with International Mid-Market Companies, Large Corporates and Entrepreneurs.  I have developed a methodology for international audits that my clients really value. There are some key principles to the methodology, but the process can be flexed to each client‚Äôs circumstances delivering a tailored and efficient audit experience. I deliver regular training to my team who are skilled and take ownership for delivering the benefits associated with the methodology on a consistent basis. If CFOs value their time, dislike late surprises and think meeting deadlines are important, this methodology is the perfect fit. I work with CFOs to ensure that they are clear on accounting matters and whether they are black or white or judgemental. Where they are judgemental, I work with my clients to ensure that the judgements made are reasonable, commercial, and robust. CFOs regularly comment that they have received a better audit experience working with ECOVIS than they have received working with some of our competitors and I am very proud of this feedback.   International Mid-Market CFOs tend to be self-sufficient and time poor. I make working with me easy and efficient by responding quickly, clearly, and succinctly to technical questions. I also join the CFOs finance team where there are resource constraints or skills gaps to deliver projects, particularly in the areas of corporate finance and international expansion. I build strong relationships with CFOs to enable them to maximise the positive impact they can have in and on their companies. CFO clients like the holistic approach I take to working with them. I take ownership and responsibility for all services provided to clients and ensure all advice is co-ordinated with the ‚Äòbig picture‚Äô in mind. I use my technical skills and experience of working with over 250 companies in the last 28 years to be a reliable and trusted advisor to CFOs of International Mid-Market companies. ECOVIS Wingrave Yeats is the exclusive UK accounting member firm of ECOVIS International, a network of audit, consulting, tax, accounting and legal firms with 12,000 people operating in 90 countries around the globe.

linkedinheadline: Art & Tech | Art Collector and Co-Founder & CEO at MyArtBroker - Secondary Market Art Print Specialists
linkedindescription: Specialising in Banksy since its heyday MyArtBroker leads the private sales market in the UK for art collectors looking for an alternative to auction or traditional gallery purchase and trade options.  I launched MyArtBroker alongside my brother, art dealer Joe Syer, in 2010, providing a transparent and convenient introductory service for those looking to buy and sell original prints and editions on the secondary market. The network consists of over 25,000 collectors of contemporary and modern prints and multiples, from contemporary artists with strong secondary markets, to 20th Century masters such a Warhol, Haring and Lichtenstein. Our team of experts is made up of specialists in the market for Banksy, Hirst, Hockney, Warhol, Haring, Lichtenstein and Bridget Riley. MyArtBroker provides the only dedicated print market index in the world, MyPortfolio - powered by repeat sales regression technology. Buy, sell & track demand and supply of the prints, multiples & editions market in real-time.MyPortfolio is updated in real-time. It shows you live activity in real-time, and connects you with active collectors and investors worldwide, taking requests to source particular artworks, or offering others for sale.The algorithm tracks over 48,500 auction histories & our own private sales data across 3,500 artworks spanning 30 years, including signed, unsigned, APs, PPs, TPs and sets of prints & editions.Build your portfolio, and make informed decisions with our precision data. Become a member for free, DM me for a link to sign up.

linkedinpreviousjobdescription: -Weddingcarsforhire contacted us to get their website designed.-We first gave them requirements documents to ask about how many services they offered, what kind of cars they had for hiring, their packages and corresponding prices, their color palette preference, contact info, and social links. This document also guided them about which files we needed from them; website content and HD quality images of their cars, if they had any, and logo files. -Once we had all the complete information, our web designer went to work under the supervision of our creative team lead.-They soon organized all the information into different categories and subcategories to create a visual hierarchy, make the website well-organized and facilitate easy browsing for our client's visitors.-Our copywriter then sprinkled his magic with words onto this little cocktail of high-conversion that demonstrated that our client was perhaps even more excited about the wedding of his customers than the bride. His persuasive words also helped our client's customers visualize what hiring our cars would feel like and entail; He painted a captivating picture of luxury, comfort, and excitement in the home and service page content.-Our designer complemented the copywriter's hard work and added more weight and impact by adding the most stunning images of his cars on every page as static images or slideshows. He also added an amazing parallax scrolling effect on the background of images that made the background scroll with the mouse's scroll to add even more allure and enhance the user experience. linkedindescription: As a Social Media Director at Brilliant Beam Media, my days are fueled by crafting strategies that not only captivate but also drive results for both B2B and B2C ventures. Fluent in Spanish-speaking and Spanish to English translation, I've had the privilege of bridging cultural gaps and amplifying brand voices across diverse audiences.Beyond the boardroom, I wear the badges of a Walking Tall Movement Ambassador and a proud member of The Outlier Project with immense pride. These roles aren't just titles; they're opportunities to pay it forward. My heart beats for empowering fellow Latino entrepreneurs, especially the resilient women who navigate through cultural and personal barriers with grace and grit.Through the intimate avenues of my podcast, coaching sessions, and the pages of my soon-to-be-released book, "Culture Clash," I don't just share stories‚ÄîI share journeys. My own journey from the tumultuous streets of El Salvador to the corridors of opportunity in the United States serves as a beacon of hope. But more importantly, it's a roadmap for those who dare to dream, guiding them from the realm of possibility to the realm of action.My mission is simple yet profound: to give voice to the voiceless, to provide platforms for the overlooked, and to equip aspiring entrepreneurs with the tools they need to thrive. And as we continue on this transformative journey together, let's not forget the power of community. On LinkedIn, I've cultivated not just connections but a family‚Äîa tribe of diverse souls united by shared dreams and mutual support.Join me, not just as a spectator, but as a fellow architect of change. Together, let's shatter barriers, rewrite narratives, and pave the way for a future where every dream is not just realized but celebrated.

Morgan, where I finally saw the real workings of high finance.I loved the intensity, but I realised my true passion was building businesses and helping others find their footing. Here's my story: I've had two exits, and helped many business owners grow by acquiring businesses and achieving successful trade sales or IPOs.Today, I am the Founder & CEO of JustFix: a tech company on a mission to modernise the home maintenance sector.But it all started for me in 1998, when I founded iChoose Radio, a forerunner to Spotify. It was also the first company to stream live from Glastonbury.By 2007, I had moved on from iChoose Radio and went on to co-found a new digital agency, Saint, which would go on to win agency of the year, twice, in 2011.In 2012, I joined a digital marketing agency called Weapon7 within the Omnicom network, where I assumed the role of CEO. At this time, I drove nee business and won clients such as Bacardi and a little-known start-up called Headspace.Then, in 2016 I began a new career adventure with The Marketing Group Plc as CEO, where I focused on mergers and acquisitions, investor relations, and business optimisation.2021, I launched JustFix.My journey has been full of valuable lessons, and I'd love to share them with the world.Give me a follow if you're interested in:‚Üí Developing a Growth Mindset‚Üí Leadership & Culture‚Üí Productivity‚Üí Entrepreneurship & Start-ups‚Üí Merger & Acquisitionsüëâ¬†From an entrepreneur with 25+ years in the game.

linkedinpreviousjobdescription: Jennifer co-founded New Leaf Biofuel in 2006 and has led the company over 18 years to being recognized nationally as a major player in the biodiesel space.  Jennifer served as the Chair of the California Advanced Biofuels Alliance and also served on the National Biodiesel Board where she has held various officer and committee positions over the years. Jennifer is recognized by her peers as a leader and spokesperson for community sized biodiesel plants across the country, and has testified on their behalf in the US House of Representatives‚Äô Energy and Commerce Committee and the Environmental Protection Agency.  She has also previously served on the boards of the San Diego Regional Clean Cities Coalition and the San Diego chapter of the California Restaurant Association.  Jennifer wrote several successful competitive grants during her tenure including three for biodiesel production and one for renewable fuel infrastructure.  During her last year, she successfully commissioned a 7 million dollar renewable fuel terminal for storage and distribution of ethanol, biodiesel & renewable diesel. Jennifer has raised over 6 million dollars for the Company through various grants to the California Energy Commission and Air Resources Board.  Drawing on her experience in the legal field, Jennifer coordinated with each of the City and County agencies to ensure compliance with all land use and environmental regulations.  When she is not working on strategy with her management team, she is in Sacramento or Washington DC advocating for policy that will strengthen the renewable fuels industry and combat climate change.

linkedindescription: Struggling with customer retention?Not sure how to stop revenue leakage that keeps growing every day?(keep reading)As a marketing leader and consultant with recurring-revenue businesses, I have seen the debilitating impact that churn has on profitability and growth. To avoid this recurring-revenue death trap, you need to build stronger customer relationships that reduce your reliance on adding new logos and a ‚Äògrowth at all costs‚Äô approach.If you are an info or tech company that depends on recurring revenues, and you‚Äôre struggling with churn‚ùå Always in reactive mode, plugging revenue leaks and replacing lost revenues‚ùå Tired of key account fire drills which usually don‚Äôt work (11th hour ultimatums, renewal delays)‚ùå Sick of unpredictable revenue performance (and customer acquisition is already taking longer)‚ùå Done with infighting and finger pointing (you‚Äôve already tried NPS, Health Scores, and QBRs) I‚Äôve got something that‚Äôll put an end to your misery, once and for all.  It‚Äôs called Customer Synergy Engine, a system that information, technology and software providers can use to improve customer retention and expansion. Through this system, you‚Äôll identify avenues for enhanced and highly profitable revenue growth through a cheap, efficient, and dependable source of leads and new revenue: your current customers.When you harness Customer Synergy Engine for your business, you will: ‚úÖ Improve net revenue retention by reducing leakage and improving expansion‚úÖ Increase consistency and sustainability of  top- and bottom-line performance ‚úÖ Stop firefighting to address customer crises  (negotiations and saves) at  the 11th hour‚úÖ Build customer relationships and positive word-of-mouth to propel your business forward  Most consulting programs are about quick fixes and playing defense, but not ours. Customer Synergy Engine tackles retention, and then we proactively harness customer insights and success to amp up upselling and cross-selling and positive word of mouth. And you'll find innovative approaches to take your customer relationships to the next level. With the right system in place, you can stop reacting and start increasing expansion and referrals because you will have developed a consistent and dependable revenue engine that is powered by customers who know, love and trust you. Let‚Äôs talk about how you can start Customer Synergy Engine  today. Book a call with me here: https://calendly.com/growthcanvasconsulting-2468/30min

linkedinheadline: Cofounder. Facilitator. Coach. Anthropologist.
linkedindescription: Most people know I'll always be the one to view the world as limitless and full of opportunity. My goal in life is to bring this lens into the lives of millions.Over the last two decades, I've worked as a coach and facilitator, training and coaching people all over the world. My gift and role in life is to inspire those whose role it is to inspire the next generation. Teachers and parents are my people as they are able to make or break the young ones of a society and consequently, can dramatically alter the future of our world. Therefore, I choose to inspire, champion and drive them towards being the best version of themselves. In 2011, I co-founded Graydin with McKenzie Cerri to share the power of coaching within educational communities around the world. Before that, I co-founded a small charity called Akosia when I was 24 with Maria Schonfeld. We facilitated creative projects for underprivileged children for 10 years. No longer in operation, though we made tremendous impact in the time we did. We ran 9 projects in Ghana, 3 in Mexico, 2 in Israel and 2 in Mongolia. All our projects stood by the belief that creativity unlocks potential.I'm currently working on a YA novel with my high school drama teacher, Jane Czarny. The working title is 'KC Kane: Overcoming'. KC Kane is not your average teenager. A gifted musician who lives on the spectrum, she brings her neuroatypical outlook to all of the usual teen struggles, from unrequited love to avoiding the mean group at school and dodging unsympathetic teachers. But there is a ghost haunting her, the woman who died while giving birth to her seventeen years earlier. Consumed with a pervasive sense of guilt that even her sweetly supportive father can‚Äôt overcome, KC turns to her loving community of friends for support when her plans for the future go sideways... My most recent focus is on starting Gedi Village Foundation. More to come!When I grow up, my nine-year-old self would tell you I want to be a talk show host. Helping people share their stories with the world has been part of my purpose since I was very young. Whether that is through a podcast, an interview, a blog or a piece of writing, I believe people have incredible insights to share with the world. I want to tell their stories.Areas of passion: the science of learning, education transformation, coaching, stories, anthropology, social enterprise, decision making, sustainable charitable initiatives, young people, mental strength, leadership, pattern seekers, media, people (and team) development, confidence, podcasts, motivation, women.

linkedinheadline: MD at Wiispa - Happy to talk W&I / Tax / Contingent / Insurance and Life in General
linkedindescription: We were having building work done at our house in Manchester earlier in the year. After a few weeks of delivering the builders tea and biscuits whilst working from home they asked what my job was that by way of their description ‚Äúhad me chatting on the phone and laughing loudly all day long‚Äù. When I said I was an insurance broker they questioned the authenticity of my response using non-Linkedin appropriate language. I have fun at work and have enjoyed nearly twenty years in M&A during which time I have been a Corporate Lawyer, Transactional Risk Underwriter and Transactional Risk Insurance broker working for some of the biggest names in those respective fields. I herald from Leeds, worked ten years in London and was welcomed to Manchester seven years ago where I now call home. I am now a Managing Director at Wiispa where I am responsible for Transaction Execution, Strategy and Operations. At Wiispa we live by the mantra Map. Clarify. Cover. Claim. We map out an understanding of the business. We clarify risks. We cover with insurance. We assist with claims. We view insurance as having three layers on a deal: (1) the Warranty and Indemnity insurance covering unknown risks, (2) Contingent Risk Cover covering certain known risks and (3) General Insurance being the usual annually renewable business insurance policies. We believe the next evolution of Transactional Risk will see the clear thinking principles of M&A applied to General Insurance. We are on a journey to fit all the insurance pieces together. Say it quietly but we do love insurance and pushing the boundaries of what is possible. Always free for a chat on +44(0)7425355100 but do enjoy FaceTime, Teams and Zoom. Otherwise drop me an email on tim.davidson@wiispa.com.

linkedindescription: üëãI'm John. I write The Failure Blog, a Substack newsletter about how we can better learn from failure to create success. I examine the cycles of trial, error, and iteration that define the learning-through-failure process. My work considers how businesses, founders, investors, athletes, and all us in our day-to-day lives navigate setbacks, adapt, and ultimately build stronger companies, healthier live, and happier experiences by learning from our losses. Failure isn‚Äôt an endpoint. It‚Äôs feedback. If you‚Äôre interested in stories about learning through doing and failing your way to something great, subscribe to The Failure Blog.My journey started with an obsession: understanding how things work. From drumming in a band with a record deal (a terrible one, but still a deal), to studying economics at Harvard, pursuing a PhD at the University of Chicago, and ultimately building, optimizing, and selling companies, every step has been shaped by a relentless curiosity and by a obsessive willingness and drive to learn from what hasn't worked, yet. I‚Äôm the founder and CEO of 6A East Partners, a research and advisory firm exploring the question, "What is the Future of Companies?" We use data science, machine learning, and a deep desire to build meaningful human relationships with our clients to help them build better strategies, execution, and outcomes.

linkedindescription: üö® Hiring! Personal Brand Manager: https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/4149066121/Content Writer: https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/4149954016/Amplify is the content agency for creators and founders. We‚Äôve worked with Ali Abdaal, Sahil Bloom, Jordan Peterson, Chris Williamson, Greg Isenberg, Mikhaila Peterson, PLUS Andreessen Horowitz and Tony Robbins on special projects.My first job in the creator economy was working for Ali Abdaal for 3 years where, in Noah Kagan‚Äôs words, I was the ‚Äúcreator behind the creator.‚ÄùNow, we work with the biggest names in the creator economy to grow their influence online and bring that knowledge to entrepreneurs and startups who want to grow a meaningful audience across platforms.On a personal note, in 2021 I went through a severe period of burnout which was the worst year of my life. I lost my full-time job from the pandemic and put everything into starting Amplify. I flew out the gates building a business around my passion for content creation, but nobody can sprint forever.The result was damaged relationships, my first run-in with my mental health difficulties and any 'progress' I had made in those initial first business quarters was soon washed away. For months I didn't feel myself, I lost enjoyment in my work, and I couldn't make progress. I was stuck.I share this because, as a creator and founder, I know how important it is to have a great team around you and to systematise your content growth so that you can focus on what truly matters. Your content has to be a flywheel that is working for you and it's essential to have a strategy up-to-date with what's working TODAY.If you've made it this far, it's great to meet you. You're my kind of person and we'll get along well.LINKS üîó‚úçÔ∏è I share everything I know in my weekly newsletter: www.joegannon.xyz/newsletterü§ù Book a 1:1 consultation (limited spaces): https://tidycal.com/joegannon/amaüöÄ Work with Amplify: www.amplifycreators.com

linkedinheadline: Founder & CEO @ BrightQuery & BQ AI | The Factual AI Company‚Ñ¢ | MIT Economics | University of Chicago Ph.D. Economics
linkedindescription: Jose is the Founder and CEO of BrightQuery (‚ÄúBQ‚Äù) and BQ AI: The Factual AI Company‚Ñ¢. Jose has over ten years of academic experience working with U.S. statistical agencies, including the IRS, Census Bureau, Bureau of Labor Statistics, and Small Business Administration (SBA). Prior to focusing on entrepreneurship, Jose was Faculty & Executive Director of the Fink Center at the Anderson School of Management at UCLA, Adjunct Accounting Professor at the Haas School of Business at UC Berkeley, and Executive Director of the Center for Financial Reporting & Management at the Haas School of Business at UC Berkeley. While at UC Berkeley, Jose founded the Berkeley Charter of Professional Accountancy (BCPA), which has become a leading accounting program. Prior to joining UC Berkeley, Jose was Assistant Professor of Accounting at Temple University in Philadelphia, PA and Assistant Professor of Economics at SUNY Buffalo. While at SUNY Buffalo, Jose helped found the Journal of Human Capital published by the University of Chicago Press. In 2011, Jose contributed IP to co-found Powerlytics, which provides aggregated anonymized IRS tax returns on all U.S. companies and households.While at UC Berkeley, Jose received the 2015 Notable Contribution to the Accounting Literature Award, which is granted annually by the American Accounting Association (AAA) and the American Institute of CPAs (AICPA). Jose has published widely in leading academic journals, including The Accounting Review, Small Business Economics, International Journal of Industrial Organization, Review of Economic Dynamics, Journal of Economic Dynamics and Control, and Economics Letters, as well as research reports on behalf of the SBA. Jose‚Äôs academic research has been funded by the NSF and focuses on understanding the financial and economic characteristics of U.S. businesses and industries by leveraging regulatory filings and modeling the state of the economy. Jose earned a Ph.D. in Economics from the University of Chicago and B.S. degrees in Economics, Mathematics, and Management Science from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT).Jose is of Mexican origin, having spent his early childhood in Mexico City, and then growing up in Geneva, Switzerland, where his parents worked for the United Nations. Jose's father was a senior diplomat with the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) helping poorer, exporting countries negotiate with richer countries; and from his father, Jose developed his appreciation to help the world economy, reduce inequality, and protect the environment.

When companies understand their customers' needs, are able to connect with customers, and can provide a resonating message at the right time - they create lasting engagement and value with their customers. They create a relationship of shared value.Healthcare and data are highly complex. Regulatory and compliance are absolutely necessary to protect your customers - and to protect your business. Technologies have outpaced healthcare data acumen and the business models of the last 20 yrs eliminated most healthcare data experts from the businesses of healthcare - now everyone needs more data, architecture, analytics, mgmt, and governance teams. With the patient at the heart of healthcare - we also want personalized & precision medicine. But for medicine to be truly personalized, we need to understand the ecosystems influencing patient care and the barriers these ecosystems can create for patients: health/social journeys, community and personal demographics; providers, ACOs and IDNs; payers and employers; and the local, state and federal policies affecting them. Our world of healthcare is changing at such a dramatic pace, only #ADEPT business strategies can anticipate and start building the foundational capabilities that will accelerate and exceed your business goals.  Today's technology platforms, and modernized architectures can get you there... when you can define and align a Vision of People with Data - prioritized by your Business Goals: increased revenue opportunities, reduced data and tech purchase costs, robotic process automation, streamlined legal and contract reviews, Gen/AI, and full compliance by design.Be prepared... the road to real business process transformation requires a look in the mirror at "how it's always been done". University of Hertfordshire Research Lead: Law & Education (PhD, LLM by Research, LLM)
linkedindescription: Dr. Felipe Romero-Moreno is a leading expert in IT/IP law and human rights. He is a Principal Lecturer and Research Degrees Leader at Hertfordshire Schools of Law and Education, and an Executive Committee member of the British and Irish Law Education and Technology Association (BILETA).His research focuses on the intersection of new and emerging technologies (e.g., generative AI) with human rights such as intellectual property, privacy, data protection, freedom of expression and due process. His research also delves into the exciting potential of generative AI chatbots such as, OpenAI's ChatGPT or Google's Gemini exploring how this technology can transform both teaching and assessment within the dynamic world of University classrooms. Dr. Romero-Moreno is a highly accomplished scholar with a PhD, an LLM by Research in IT/IP, and an LLM in International Trade and Commercial Law from Oxford Brookes University. He is also a law graduate from the Spanish Complutense of Madrid. Dr. Romero-Moreno is passionate about using his expertise to make a positive impact on the world. He is a sought after speaker and consultant, and his work has been featured in leading academic journals and media outlets. Dr. Romero-Moreno's consultancy work has influenced policy at the highest levels of government in the UK and EU, including the UK House of Lords, UK Government, UK Parliament, UK Intellectual Property Office, EU Commission, EU Parliament, and EU Intellectual Property Office.If you are interested in learning more about the intersection of law and technology, how new technologies are impacting human rights, or about how generative AI can transform teaching and assessment within University classrooms, it is highly advisable to follow Dr. Romero-Moreno's work and get in touch with him. He is a brilliant thinker and a passionate advocate for a just and equitable society.

linkedinheadline: When Growth Feels Stagnant, Look Closer‚ÄîYour Wisdom Runs Deep | Executive & Leadership Coach & Future Author of "And So‚Ä¶ A Tree Still Grows" (2025)
linkedindescription: Have you ever felt like you were meant for more, yet somehow‚Ä¶ stuck?Like a tree that‚Äôs outgrown its pot, you sense there‚Äôs space beyond your current reality‚Äînew opportunities, deeper impact, a version of you that‚Äôs waiting to emerge. And yet, something holds you in place.I know that feeling well.After years in HR and leadership coaching, I saw brilliant, capable people shrink themselves to fit systems that weren‚Äôt built for their growth. I saw leaders struggling to show up authentically, feeling drained by expectations, and wondering if this was as far as they could go.But here‚Äôs the truth: growth is always possible‚Äîwhen it‚Äôs rooted in clarity.Simon Sinek‚Äôs Start With Why teaches us that purpose fuels everything we do‚Äîbut knowing your "why" is just the beginning. The challenge is aligning your "why" with how you lead, work, and grow. That‚Äôs where the Ens≈ç Mindset comes in.Inspired by my Japanese heritage, the Ens≈ç Mindset is about intentional growth, resilience, and alignment‚Äîhelping leaders bridge the gap between knowing their purpose and living it. Like a tree, your roots‚Äîyour values, experiences, and lessons‚Äîhold wisdom. Your trunk‚Äîyour resilience‚Äîkeeps you standing. And your branches‚Äîyour connections and impact‚Äîhave infinite room to expand.As an executive and leadership coach, I help people break through stagnation and align their "why" with their actions, leadership, and career in a way that feels authentic and sustainable. Through a human-centered approach, I work with leaders to cultivate environments where authenticity, emotional intelligence, and resilience aren‚Äôt just buzzwords‚Äîthey‚Äôre the foundation of real, meaningful success.Whether you‚Äôre a leader, an entrepreneur, or someone navigating change, my goal is to help you tap into your own wisdom, embrace growth, and create impact in a way that feels true to you.Because no matter where you are now, a tree still grows.Let‚Äôs grow together. üå±

linkedinheadline: George Mason University Inaugural VP and Chief AI Officer
linkedindescription: Dr. Amarda Shehu is the 2024 Inaugural Vice President and Chief AI Officer at George Mason University. Shehu is a Professor in the Department of Computer Science in the College of Engineering and Computing (CEC), where she also currently serves as Associate Dean for Research. She has held various positions of leadership, including CEC Associate Dean for AI Innovation (2023-2024) and Mason Associate Vice President for Research for the Institute for Digital InnovAtion (2022-2024). Shehu directs and co-directs several Centers of Excellence at the intersection of AI, Cybersecurity, Infrastructure security, and Business innovation. She obtained her Ph.D. in Computer Science from Rice University in 2008, where she was also an NIH predoctoral fellow in the Nanobiology Program under which she was dually trained in AI and Molecular Biophysics. Shehu is an internationally recognized researcher advancing foundational AI research to push the barriers of our understanding and address problems with societal resonance. Shehu has published over 190 technical papers with postdoctoral, graduate, undergraduate, and high-school students. She is a 2024 Member of the Virginia Academy of Science Engineering, and Mathematics and a 2022 Fellow of the American Institute for Medical and Biological Engineering (AIMBE). Shehu's awards include the 2022 Outstanding Faculty Award from the State Council of Higher Education for Virginia, the 2021 Beck Family Presidential Medal for Faculty Excellence in Research and Scholarship, the 2018 Mason University Teaching Excellence Award, the 2014 Mason Emerging Researcher/Scholar/Creator Award, the 2013 Mason OSCAR Undergraduate Mentor Excellence Award, and the 2012 National Science Foundation (NSF) CAREER Award. Her research is regularly supported by various NSF programs, the Department of Defense, the Small Business Administration, as well as state and private research awards. Shehu served as an NSF Program Director in the Information and Intelligent Systems Division of the Computer and Information Science and Engineering Directorate during 2019-2022. At NSF, Shehu led the working group on the HDR: Data Science Corps program and represented and led CISE efforts in the COVID-19 RAPID Program and the MFB 2022 program, for which she received two Director Recognition awards. She was also an Inaugural Founding Co-Director of the Mason Transdisciplinary Center for Advancing Human-Machine Partnerships which she led during 2019-2022.

linkedinschooldescription: I got the PhD in Digital Media, specialization in Machine Learning/Computer Vision, under a collaboration between the University of Porto and UT-Austin, Texas. The beginning was hard, trying to undertake it within the industry environment. I designed a well-defined R&D project that was approved with European funding, but its development was postponed for extra funding issues. For that reason, I redesigned my research plan, which was accepted under a scholarship program. Long journey to continuously readapt my goals and working plan within the academic environment. I investigated several problems related to the understanding of human activity in video stream on three different settings: CCTV-surveillance, multimedia-videos, and socio-behavioral-videos. Computer vision and Machine Learning to the rescue! I am very proud of what I achieved and learned.Keywords: good memories, machine learning, AI, time-to-learn-and-family, ambitious-dreams, maturity.

Some classmates and I developed a really cool 3D-tank-shooter prototyping game. During this period, I also discovered the amazing world of Computer Vision :) My first project in this area was to compile OpenCV in my powerpc laptop (hard task by that time - I ended up with a new reimplemented OpenCV release). linkedindescription: I am very excited about the future AI will bring us. From new digital worlds continuously building themselves free of human designers or on command of one, content of all mediums, individual augmentation, to the deployment of entire ecosystems based on the businesses ability to describe the outcome. It's going to be amazing to watch it all unfold and play an ever so small part in it. Rooted firmly in Microsoft's .NET technologies, my technical journey began amidst languages and frameworks such as C#, MVC, and MS-SQL. Over time, I found myself engrossed in an array of tools, from AAD, B2C, Azure Cloud, Web API, Ajax, and jQuery. Alongside these, VB.NET, WebForms, IIS and SQL Server became as familiar as the back of my hand. But it wasn't just about mastering tools. It was about weaving them into architectural masterpieces‚Äîdesigning applications, migrating to the cloud, enhancing legacy systems, and ensuring the smooth operation of various enterprise platforms.However, while Microsoft technologies became my comfort zone, my curiosity couldn't be contained. I ventured into diverse terrains, familiarizing myself with web, mobile and Linux environments. An insatiable thirst for knowledge propelled me to embrace both professional and personal training, ensuring I was always at the forefront of emerging trends and technologies.Beyond the confines of my professional commitments, I've dabbled in a myriad of projects. From developing native mobile applications and crafting software extensions to diving deep into the realms of machine learning with tools like ML.NET and TensorFlow, each project has been a testament to my passion and curiosity. My explorations in cryptography, authentication protocols, and algorithmic research have further broadened my horizons.While practice and projects enriched my professional life, my academic endeavors in object-oriented analysis, relational database architecture, and leadership gave me a robust foundation. This academic rigor equipped me to easily adapt, whether it was assimilating new coding languages or integrating into diverse organizational cultures.At the core of my professional philosophy lies an unwavering intrinsic motivation. Every project I undertake is fueled by genuine passion and a drive for excellence. In the grand tapestry of technological advancements, I view myself as a perpetual student. My milestones are not endpoints but rather markers of a journey that's all about growth, learning, and pushing the boundaries of what's possible.

The industry deploys the simple process of buying stuff to the immensely complex process of connecting with human beings. The result is an inefficient process that makes everyone miserable, treats people like products, and adds to harmful narratives.A transformative experience showed me the power of human connections and collaborative community. I realized hierarchical management limits an organization‚Äôs collective insight by putting leadership in an impossible position of thinking they are responsible for all ideas, destroying employee creativity/initiative, and limiting the ability to understand complexity.I founded True Bearing to pioneer new models leveraging culture, storytelling and human-centered principles to transform recruiting practices and how companies connect with talent.Now, as a professional speaker, storyteller and workshop facilitator, I combine my passion for purpose and narrative to drive change, foster collaboration, and reveal our shared humanity. I provide audiences with imaginative, empathetic takeaways by reframing topics through the lens of shared stories.I‚Äôm here to help guide organizations through this unprecedented reinvention by tapping into the human superpowers of imagination, empathy and community.
