linkedindescription: Dr. Ernesto Sirolli is one of the world' s leading consultants on the topic of economic development. He started working in the field of International Aid in Africa in 1971 and has since worked in Australia, New Zealand, Canada, the United Kingdom, Latin America and Asia in projects that promote local entrepreneurship and local self determination. Dr. Sirolli resides in California, USA where he was invited to establish the Sirolli Institute, a social enterprise that teaches:- civic leaders to capture the passion energy and imagination of their own citizens- corporations to empower local entrepreneurs to create local wealth- entrepreneurs to form passionate teams capable to transform dreams into viable enterprises.Dr. Sirolli received a Laurea di Dottore in Political Sciences from Rome University in 1976 and a Ph.D in Local Enterprise Facilitation from Murdoch University, Australia in 2004.Dr. Ernesto Sirolli received The 2016  IOEE International Lifetime Achievement Award for Entrepreneurship Education at the House of Lords in London.Dr. Sirolli is the author of two books: "Ripples from the Zambezi" a best seller that is used by Economic Development Faculties in Universities the world over, and :"How to start a business and ignite your life" a book aimed at would be entrepreneurs. In 2012 Dr. Sirolli was invited to give a TED TALK ; his talk :"Shut up and Listen" has been translated in 31 languages and downloaded more than 3.8 million times.

linkedinheadline: Alpha Rho Technologies LLC Founder | Quantitative Investing Strategies
linkedindescription: When I was 18, I placed my first trade.It was 2019. After making 300% gains in my demo account (right for the wrong reasons) I felt ‚Äúready‚Äù to trade with real money.Then the COVID-19 market crash hit and wiped out my savings. Losing everything was tough, but instead of letting it defeat me, I saw it as a wake-up call.I needed to invest in education. I earned two Level 5 financial certifications and graduated with honours from ESADE University, excelling in every finance course. I joined the Chartered Institute of Securities and Investment (CISI) in London and travelled globally to learn from top investors like Ray Dalio and Stanley Druckenmiller.But I realized knowledge wasn't enough.I began managing investments for close friends and family, shouldering the responsibility of their trust. While working at Quadriga Asset Management's hedge fund, I predicted the 2022 market downturn. Acting on that insight, I safeguarded my clients' investments, and my assets under management grew from ‚Ç¨10,000 to seven figures.Yet, something was missing.I had many ideas I couldn't execute due to my tech skills being limited to Excel.I needed more powerful tools to break my limits.I didn't have a background in tech and was afraid of coding, but I pushed myself to program a simple Monte Carlo simulation script.And guess what? It worked! And I was hooked.Gone were my limitations. Gone was being stuck. Gone was the inability to test my ideas.Combining finance knowledge with powerful computing tools was a game-changer.Noticing a technological gap in the asset management industry, I was determined to make a change.In 2022, I founded Alpha Rho Technologies LLC with a clear vision: to lead the technological revolution in asset management.Now, I'm combining my passion for finance with cutting-edge technology to reshape the future of investing.

That's precisely our mission. We collaborate with you to identify your specific business intelligence requirements and then craft customized solutions to meet them. Our commitment extends beyond delivering answers; we ensure you have the actionable insights necessary to make informed, strategic decisions, including where to invest your resources effectively.We specialize in empowering real estate developers with comprehensive analyses of land parcels, synthesizing disparate datasets from authoritative sources. Our databases are meticulously designed to incorporate the precise information you seek, presented in a format tailored to your preferences. Utilizing our proprietary methodology, we excel at pinpointing contiguous land parcels in densely populated urban areas, such as Los Angeles and New York City, particularly those under unified ownership (assemblages).Our bespoke systems are engineered to mitigate risks from the outset of your property searches. Say goodbye to the arduous task of sifting through endless deal flow to uncover hidden challenges. Instead, our solutions enable you to focus your time and resources exclusively on properties aligned with your project objectives. We facilitate:- Land searches revealing underutilized zoning opportunities.- Identification of contiguous lots held under unified ownership.- Comprehensive insights into construction and building activity.Our services cater to a diverse array of clients, including:- Property Owners- Real Estate Investors- Multifamily Real Estate Developers- Homebuilders- Real Estate Brokers- Construction-related Businesses

linkedinheadline: Founder of Skill Foundry | Bridging the Skills Gap through Technical Expertise and Instructional Mastery
linkedindescription: Hey there! I'm an entrepreneur who's been around the block a couple of times in the world of technical education startups. I've led two successful companies to the finish line, and I've discovered that my true calling is creating learning experiences that leave a lasting impact.Over the years, I've had the opportunity to transform the lives of thousands of learners across various settings. One such opportunity was starting Skill Foundry. It‚Äôs direct-to-consumer, and for the first time, I‚Äôm able to bring the quality, rigor, and outcomes of what I do for individuals.Building on the success of Skill Foundry, I'm also able to scratch my itch to interact on an individual level while still bringing my expertise to education organizations and enterprises with Cyanna Academics. With more than a decade of industry experience under my belt, my goal is to help organizations develop and implement reskilling and upskilling programs that are both effective and cutting-edge.At Cyanna Academics, we design and deliver learner experiences that really hit the mark. Our team crafts processes and operations that cover everything from enrollment and learner engagement to instructor management (think hiring, training, and assessment). We also take pride in creating modular curricula, compelling video content, and assessments that are spot-on and make a real difference.We know that keeping an in-house team for content creation and video production can be a real headache for organizations. That's why I tap into my extensive network of top-notch professionals to provide a smooth outsourcing solution. This way, our clients get the high-quality results they need without the hassle of managing their own teams, freeing them up to focus on their core business and adjust their spending as needed.As I continue on this exciting journey, my mission is to help even more organizations reach their full potential through Cyanna Academics. I'm committed to being a trusted partner and leader in the world of technical training strategy.If you're curious about how Cyanna Academics can help design, build, or level up your reskilling or upskilling program, shoot me a DM!

linkedinheadline: Director of Operations at Ampcera Inc.
linkedindescription: Ph.D. in analytical chemistry from Kansas State University with a focus in developing and characterizing electrochemical energy storage materials.  The emphasis of my research has been the development of state-of-the-art core-shell electrodes for lithium and sodium ion batteries.  However, I have published over 10 papers encompassing many of the other common technologies including solid state supercapacitors, relaxor-ferroelectric capacitors, pseudocapacitors. I am expert in the characterization and evaluation of electrochemical energy storage materials. The electrochemical characterization techniques I'm familiar with include cyclic voltammetery, galavonstatic charge-discharge, self discharge, AC impedance, life cycling and rate capability.  I have accomplished many of these techniques using Instruments such as the CHI Electrochemical Workstation, Princeton Applied Research PARSTAT 2273 Advanced Electrochemical System, Ivium-n-Stat Multichannel potentiostat and a MTI 8-Channle Battery Analyzer.During my time at K-State I was the sole operator of a Topcon/ISI/ABT DS 130F Field Emission Scanning Electron Microscope (FESEM) where I would conduct routine imaging for colleagues as well as conduct maintenance and collaborate with the service engineer.  Moreover, I‚Äôm also trained on more modern instruments such as an FEI Versa 3D Dual Beam FESEM and a CM-100 Phillips Transmission Electron Microscope.  Materials characterization techniques that I‚Äôm familiar with include Raman spectroscopy, x-ray diffraction (XRD), thermal gravimetric analysis (TGA), Brunauer‚ÄìEmmett‚ÄìTeller (BET), x-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) and energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (EDS).  I also have experience in operating and maintaining other essential instruments such as the Aixtron Black Magic Plasma Enhanced Chemical Vapor Deposition, a Gatan Ion Sputtering system, Perkin Elmer AAnalyst 400 Flame Atomic Absorption Spectrometer and a CEM Discovery SP-Series Microwave Oven.

linkedinschooldescription: Ph.D. in analytical chemistry with a focus in developing and characterizing new electrode materials for electrical energy storage technologies. linkedinheadline: //I work tirelessly on connecting Science to Innovation// Material & nanotechnology Scientist - Accidental Entrepreneur - I help scientists and engineers transform their scientific results into business projects -
linkedindescription: I'm a material chemist who worked in many domains: lithium batteries, dye-sensitized solar cells, electrochromic materials, inorganic membranes or self-assembled nanostructured materials... I created systems for CO2 capture, photobioreactors, nanoceramic surface coating and even patented a new document search engine.Beyond my academic activity as a Senior Scientist at CNRS in France or Asso. Professor in Canada, I've always tried to reconcile research and Innovation, creating two startups, one on biotechnologies and one on information technology.And this is how I became an "accidental entrepreneur"...An accidental entrepreneur is not legit in Business because they don't have credibility, the right background or vocabulary, and the right social network.Accidental entrepreneurs took the wrong turn and started to do something they were not supposed to. And this is how they got the "impostor syndrome" sickness.I probably made all possible mistakes until I realized that "Innovation" is not an invention left on a shelf or just a claim in a publication.The fact is that Innovation only exists if some people are willing to use it and even pay for it! The rest is "blah blah."I also discovered that creating an innovation project requires many skills beyond our core scientific expertise.Now it's time to help people who want to pursue their dream of bringing real solutions to our world but don't know how to proceed and suffer from the "impostor syndrome."Why? Because Science and Business are two worlds "divided by a common language."Scientists try tirelessly to explain why their invention is so great. At the same time, business people are frustrated to see scientists giving the tiniest detail of it before explaining how they will generate revenues.So, if you are a scientist or engineer lost in translation, here are some topics I can help you with:- Learn how to go from an idea or a discovery to a business model via the "8 steps-to-innovation," a method specifically adapted to scientists and engineers.- Learn how to create "bulletproof presentations" that go straight to the topic and help people efficiently share their message. Indeed, why have a great idea if you cannot share it properly?- Learn how to use mind maps.- Get help creating, improving or adapting materials for real-life applications.I‚Äôve been working at the crossroads of research, Innovation, entrepreneurship and education. Suppose you feel the first symptoms of the "accidental entrepreneur" or need some support to refine your project.Why don't we start a conversation?Eric
linkedinskillslabel: Startups, Nanocomposites, New Business Development, Innovation Management, Research, Materials Science, Innovation Development, Chemistry, Science, Nanomaterials, Nanotechnology, Higher Education, Research and Development (R&D), Distance Learning, Teaching, Student Development, Presentation Skills, Paperless, Mind Mapping, Nanoparticles

linkedindescription: Hi, I am Markus,a multi-award-winning serial entrepreneur and the man behind L√≥ng Capital Management, a leading company builder and investment firm routed in the success of my first startup, the groundbreaking FIMAR Group, as well as an attempt to better align my role, capabilities, personality, and own goals.This said, I've substantial experience in entrepreneurial ventures holding subject-matter and management responsibilities spanning a range of topics as broad as finance (esp. treasury, M&A, FP&A), technology, product management, strategy and marketing.Hence I am used to working on multiple projects and in several roles at once as well as to handle ambiguous tasks and high pressure with self-confidence, creativity and an exceptionally good sense for people (Gallup: Individualization).What's more, I am a passionate strategist, competitive doer of things and gritty visionary who overcame several backlashes and adversities.In my scarce spare time I love to explore the world (sailed all seven seas and like hiking / via ferrate) but also enjoy cooking, rock music, playing chess, and reading books to keep my mind sharp and alert. With regards to the latter, I am also taking seemingly disparate classes at leading universities and other providers on a regular basis which again leads me to innovative ideas or solutions for current challenges and business opportunities. Hence consider me an "expert-generalist".Plus, as a certified business facilitator I know how to leverage my ENTP personality (Big Five: Openness 93rd, Conscientiousness: 72nd, Extraversion: 80th, Agreeableness 27th, Neuroticism 22th percentile) to achieve above-average results and grow the various business lines and ventures at an incredible pace.More so, I learned to embrace my ADHD to achieve even better business results while C-PTSD (a.o. childhood bullying) not only fueled me but also helped me build extreme resilience and the same goes for my therewith associated personality disorders (OCPD, NPD, ASPD) which I'm working on yet also learned to harness as valuable business tools.Given all that and my attitude of doing whatever it takes to improve the state of the world, solve some of the toughest problems and hit key milestones I have gone through a lot from initially sleeping on trains, to turning myself into "a walking LBO" and winning high-stake court battles (some even against toxic family members) all while making billions, losing billions (well 2020-2023 were tough) and bouncing back way stronger again in those pursuits.So join me in changing the world!

linkedinschooldescription: In the summer of 2011, I had the opportunity to partake in a five-week program focused on Social Entrepreneurship at Connecticut University. Thanks to the scholarship funded by the US Department of State, I embarked on an enriching journey of discovery. I met American entrepreneurs who hailed from every state, and shared their path to success. They imparted invaluable tips and advice on how to thrive in the competitive world of business. My entrepreneurial spirit was further stoked when I pitched my start-up at the Ashoka Youth Venture in New York City. I was thrilled to emerge as a winner, clinching a grant to launch my venture upon returning to Egypt. The experience left an indelible impression on me, inspiring me to pay it forward by empowering and mentoring others on their entrepreneurial journeys.
linkedinpreviousschooldescription: I was fortunate to have been awarded a scholarship by EMUNI University to study Entrepreneurship and Innovation. The program was a well-rounded mix of field visits, research, and a series of enlightening lectures and workshops. During the course of my study, I spent two weeks at EMUNI University, Slovenia, and a further two weeks at the University of Siena, Italy. The experience broadened my horizons, allowing me to delve into the intricacies of entrepreneurship and innovation from two contrasting perspectives. Thanks to the scholarship, I was able to expand my intellectual horizons, sharpen my skills, and network with my peers and reputable professionals in the field. The study was an unforgettable journey, one that has equipped me with the knowledge and skills to thrive in the ever-changing world of entrepreneurship.

linkedinheadline: Managing Partner at The Legal Team, PLLC
linkedindescription: Karel Suarez is the founding and managing partner of The Legal Team, PLLC.  Karel practices complex commercial and international litigation at the trial and appellate levels.  He also advises clients on international law with a focus on Cuba.In the litigation arena, Karel primarily handles highly contested matters involving large sums of money and multiple parties in Florida‚Äôs state and federal courts.  He has successfully argued various cases in the Complex Business Division of the Eleventh Judicial Circuit.  Karel has also conducted Oral Arguments at the Third District Court of Appeal.Prior to founding The Legal Team, PLLC, Karel was an associate at a prominent Florida law firm, where he handled various types of cases in Federal court including commercial and bankruptcy litigation.  Karel has experience taking and defending depositions and has successfully mediated several cases on behalf of his clients.  He has extensive motion practice experience, not only drafting numerous motions but also arguing them in court and through Zoom.Karel is a Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (ACAMS).  He frequently advises individuals, as well as domestic and foreign companies, with respect to litigation and compliance issues related to conducting business in Cuba.In this regard, he regularly counsels clients about OFAC regulations and the applicability of Title III of the Helms-Burton Act.  Karel has travelled with representatives of U.S. and foreign companies to Cuba in order to negotiate business opportunities.Karel has been recognized by Best Lawyers: Ones to Watch and Florida Super Lawyers: Rising Star.  He currently serves as Deputy Regional President and Member of the Board of Directors for Region VIII of the Hispanic National Bar Association (HNBA).  He was also recognized by the HNBA for his leadership and service as the National President of the HNBA Law Student Division back in 2015.  Karel is a member of the Cuban American Bar Association (CABA) and the Cuba Committee of the International Law Section (ILS) of the Florida Bar.Karel was born and raised in Cuba and attended his first year of law school at the University of Havana.  He was only 19 when he arrived to the United States by himself with the goal of becoming an attorney.  After ten years of serving tables in restaurants and attending college and law school, he became a lawyer in the United States.  Karel has had to work hard and persevere his whole life and is confident that as a litigator nobody is going to outwork him.

linkedindescription: For me, marketing has always been about connections, storytelling, and purpose.Growing up in the Bronx, I learned early that every voice matters and every story deserves to be told. I didn‚Äôt realize then how much those lessons would shape my passion for marketing. My professional path began in Higher Education, where I started as a campus administrator focused on marketing, enrollment management, and student development. Promoting the value of higher education to students from diverse backgrounds taught me a lot about ‚Äúmarketing the intangible.‚Äù It wasn‚Äôt just about numbers or programs; it was about connecting with human aspirations and potential.As I moved into roles like Director of Student Development, VP of Operations, and eventually Campus President, I discovered a universal truth: Every institution has its own story to tell. My mission was to bring those stories to life, helping them resonate with students, families, and communities. Higher education wasn‚Äôt just a career for me‚Äîit was a way to foster connection, growth, and transformation.Today, I‚Äôm grateful to apply my experience and purpose across different yet connected organizations.In 2019, I joined The Pink Collective, partnering with Founder and Creative Director Roly Rodriguez. We shared a vision: managing an agency that empowers positive brands. Having led a student-focused marketing agency, Tribeca Marketing Group, the move to Pink allowed me to explore new creative horizons. Now known as Pink Studio Central, our mission remains clear: helping brands grow through campaigns, content, and connections that resonate deeply.My journey also led me to Circle of One Marketing. In 2016, a meeting with Suzan McDowell, Founder and CEO, sparked a lasting partnership. Circle had already built an unparalleled reputation in Public Relations and Event Management, and our shared passion for purposeful marketing made collaboration natural. Today, as the Circle‚Äôs VP of Brand Development, I get to combine expertise and resources from both agencies, delivering greater value to every client.For me, marketing isn‚Äôt just a profession, it‚Äôs about building connections and fostering growth. Whether I‚Äôm mentoring small businesses, leading workshops, or developing campaigns, I bring the grit of my Bronx roots and a diverse marketing perspective to everything I do. Throughout my professional journey one thing that has remained consistent: Every story matters.Let‚Äôs connect! I‚Äôd love to hear your story and explore how we can grow together.

linkedindescription: Darren is a distinguished government affairs counsel and regulatory lawyer who serves as a trusted advisor to private equity firms and their portfolio companies across multiple industries.
